identificationModule.officialTitle: The Effects of Strength Training on Neuromuscular Function and Muscle Lipids.

collaborators.name: National Strength and Conditioning Association Foundation

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is examine the effects of 8 weeks (3 days/week) of resistance exercise training in children 8 to 10 years of age on muscle strength and power, motor unit activation, and lipid profiles of the vastus lateralis.

interventions.name: Resistance exercise training
interventions.description: Participants will strength train via linear periodization resistance exercise training.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in muscular power of the leg extensors, as measured with isokinetic strength testing.
primaryOutcomes.description: The score will reflect the muscular power of the leg extensors. The higher score, reflects greater muscular strength.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in thigh muscle cross-sectional area
secondaryOutcomes.description: Scores are measured cross-sectional area from ultrasound images. The higher score, reflects greater muscle size of the leg extensors.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in intramyocellular lipids of the vastus lateralis, as measure with magnetic resonance spectroscopy
otherOutcomes.description: The score will reflect a concentration. The higher score, reflects more fat in the fibers.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in extramyocellular lipids of the vastus lateralis, as measure with magnetic resonance spectroscopy
otherOutcomes.description: The score will reflect a concentration. The higher score, reflects more fat in the fibers.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in the fatty acid saturation levels of the extramyocellular lipids of the vastus lateralis, as measure with magnetic resonance spectroscopy
otherOutcomes.description: The score will reflect a saturation level of fatty acids in the extramyocellular lipid. The higher score, reflects greater fatty acid saturation.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in the fatty acid saturation levels of the intramyocellular lipids of the vastus lateralis, as measure with magnetic resonance spectroscopy
otherOutcomes.description: The score will reflect a saturation level of fatty acids in the intramyocellular lipid. The higher score, reflects greater fatty acid saturation.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in motor unit activation, as measured with surface electromyography decomposition.
otherOutcomes.description: The score will reflect the firing rates of recorded motor units. The higher score, reflects greater motor unit activation.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in total body lean mass, as measured with bioelectrical impedance analysis.
otherOutcomes.description: The score will reflect the lean mass. The higher score, reflects greater lean mass.

otherOutcomes.measure: Change in total body fat mass, as measured with bioelectrical impedance analysis.
otherOutcomes.description: The score will reflect the fat mass. The higher score, reflects greater fat mass.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Healthy volunteer males and females ages 8 - 10 years.

Exclusion Criteria:

* No history or ongoing neuromuscular diseases.
* No history or ongoing musculoskeletal injuries.
* No history or ongoing disease that effects metabolism.
